heading: 9-Card Golf
body: A two-player card game where the goal is to score the fewest points. Each player has a 3x3 grid of cards. Take turns drawing and swapping cards to lower your score before the round ends.

heading: Setup
body: Each player receives 9 cards arranged in a 3x3 grid, all face-down. Before the first turn, each player flips 3 of their cards face-up. The remaining cards form the stock pile, and one card is turned face-up to start the discard pile.

heading: Turn Flow
body:
On your turn:

1. Draw a card from either the stock pile (face-down) or the discard pile (face-up).

2. Then choose one of two actions:
   a) Swap the drawn card with any card in your grid. The replaced card goes to the discard pile.
   b) Discard the drawn card and flip one of your face-down cards face-up.

heading: Round End
body: When any player's grid is fully face-up (all 9 cards revealed), every other player gets one final turn. After those final turns, the round ends and all remaining face-down cards are revealed for scoring.

heading: Scoring
body:
Lower scores are better.

Card values:
  A = 1 point
  2 = -2 points (subtract!)
  3 through 10 = face value
  J, Q = 10 points
  K = 0 points

Column bonus: If all three cards in a column have the same rank, that entire column scores 0 points regardless of the individual card values. Use this to your advantage!

heading: Tips
body:
- Kings are free (0 points) -- keep them.
- Twos subtract 2 points -- very valuable.
- Try to match three of the same rank in a column for a 0-point column bonus.
- Drawing from the discard pile lets you see the card first -- less risky.
- Pay attention to what the AI discards for clues about its strategy.

heading: Controls
body:
Click the stock pile or discard pile to draw a card. Then click a card in your grid to swap, or click the discard pile to discard and choose a face-down card to flip.

Press ? to toggle this help panel.
